db:abstract.db:para: Defines a set of items to be used as a model.
This type was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A ObjectModel contains the visual items to be used in a view. When a ObjectModel is used in a view, the view does not require a delegate since the ObjectModel already contains the visual delegate (items).
An item can determine its index within the model via the index attached property.
The example below places three colored rectangles in a ListView.

db:section.db:title: count : int
db:section.db:para: The number of items in the model. This property is readonly.

db:section.db:title: ObjectModel.index : int
db:section.db:para: This attached property holds the index of this delegate's item within the model.
It is attached to each instance of the delegate.
